summary: I read some spoilers for the end of Game of Thrones. It is so bizarre. [[MORE]] Apparently Jon kills Dany (and I had always...
body:
I read some spoilers for the end of Game of Thrones. It is so bizarre.

Apparently Jon kills Dany (and I had always expected one of them to kill the other, per the Azor Ahai prophecy but doing it AFTER the White Walker threat is defeated makes NO SENSE).

It’s sort of like GRRM gave them an outline but D&D can’t read very well so they only got bits and bobs.

Tyrion and Jon are both brought before some kind of ruling Council. This also makes no sense because I can’t imagine everyone is suddenly on the same page. Like the Dornish? And the Tyrells? IDK.

Jon is apparently sent to the Wall which is so stupid because he was fucking supposed to STAY ON THE WALL this entire damned time. He made a vow.

Conflicting reports as to whether Tyrion survives or is killed.

And here is the WEIRDEST thing. Apparently the Council picks… wait for it… Bran to be king.

Now, for those of you who don’t know, I was always a Bran Stark stan. He was my favorite. And a lot of people online say he is BORING and it makes me mad. I would fight with people about his ability to be the Stark in Winterfell and they would say he couldn’t because he can’t father children (allegedly).

But there has been absolutely nothing in the books to suggest that Bran would want the Iron Throne. In fact, he repeatedly thinks that Robb is “marching the wrong way.”

Sansa is the one being prepared for political life. Bran learned magic and Northern stuff.

Also, like, if Bran is so damned important why did they CUT HIS CHARACTER FOR AN ENTIRE FUCKING SEASON. Maybe that was when he was getting King lessons?

I mean, I think the whole point of the books is that politics is hard and it corrupts people even if they have a good heart and good intentions initially. (At least with Robert, Ned, and Dany.) So why would they just pick someone new to King’s Landing politics to end?

It’s like… all of this has meant nothing?


ETA: Obviously I don’t know this to be true but it is so out of left field it feels like something these assholes would come up with. Because D&D are basically like trolls who write fake spoilers on the internet?
body_abstract: I read some spoilers for the end of Game of Thrones. It is so bizarre.

blog.name: maestroofradiogallifreywesteros
blog.title: Would my life be easier without fandoms..? Erm
blog.description:
I suffer with IBD...which rules my life. My shipping habits/ obsessions change almost monthly depending on my appetite. I like sci-fi, fantasy, historical, adventure and comedies. Enjoy larking about the supernatural and paranormal.
I'm a fan of David Bowie (RIP), I had a faze where everything was him.. I'm on fanfiction.net and youtube. My Fandoms; Game Of Thrones, Harry Potter, Doctor Who, Merlin, Supernatural, Once Upon A Time, Hannibal, Bates Motel, Teen Wolf, Endeavour, Sherlock, Ashes to Ashes, Life On Mars.

body:
Varys Theory

So you guys remember when Varys said something like “maybe the person that doesn’t want to be King is the best choice” and we all assumed it was Jon?

Well, don’t forget about the scene between Bran and Tyrion when Bran says he doesn’t wanna be Lord of Winterfell and Tyrion replies with blah blah blah I can’t remember (sorry).

Basically: Bran will be King, Tyrion or Sansa will be his hand (likely Tyrion since Sansa wants to be the Warden of the North and the Lady of Winterfell— the true power of the North).

That’s it. That’s what I want. If Jon sits on the throne I’ll hate it even more than I already do. I love Jon as a character, but come on…

summary: “Yes,” Robb said, with such hope in his voice that Bran knew he was hearing his brother and not just Robb the Lord. “Mother will...
caption:
“Yes,” Robb said, with such hope in his voice that Bran knew he was hearing his brother and not just Robb the Lord. “Mother will be home soon. Maybe we can ride out to meet her when she comes. Wouldn’t that surprise her, to see you ahorse?” Even in the dark room, Bran could feel his brother’s smile. “And afterward, we’ll ride north to see the Wall. We won’t even tell Jon we’re coming, we’ll just be there one day, you and me. It will be an adventure.”
“An adventure,” Bran repeated wistfully. He heard his brother sob. The room was so dark he could not see the tears on Robb’s face, so he reached out and found his hand. Their fingers twined together.  — BRAN, AGOT IV

blog.name: lady-griffin
blog.title: LadyGriffin's Home
blog.description: A bad idea written down is far better and far more useful to you than a blank sheet of paper and a mythical piece of brilliance that has been stuck in your head out of fear of failure. Go ahead and fail. Then make it better.

title: GOT LEAK TALK
body:
My reaction/take on a popular leak, I’ve been seeing. Avoid reading, in case it turns out to be true and you don’t want to be spoiled.

The only reason why I could see them making Bran a King, is because Bran literally stated he doesn’t want anything. And as Varys and Tyrion have said (and others), the best person to rule would be someone who doesn’t want to rule…

Like I can see the logic of that, but at the same time….wow.

I really hope that’s not the case, because…again wow. Like that’s just the most simplified, basic and literal interpretion of that philosophy.

I like the idea of a council, though. For awhile I’ve been thinking the Kingdoms would become independent and form a council together. I always thought Harrenhall or the remains of King’s Landing would be a good spot for the official Council Meet-Up location. 

Though, in all honesty a part of me would enjoy this ending for Bran. Because that would mean it’s GRRM ending and he told them and then most likely D&D realized they haven’t done any of the foundation or leg work for that ending and basically have abandoned Bran’s story from the books…which is pretty funny. 

Will just have to see…

blog.name: theusurpersdog
blog.title: We Know No King But The King In The North

summary: When dawn broke over the city, the dark red blooms of dragon’s breath surrounded the girls where they lay. "I dreamed of Bran,”...
question: When dawn broke over the city, the dark red blooms of dragon’s breath surrounded the girls where they lay. "I dreamed of Bran,” Sansa had whispered to him. “I saw him smiling.”

blog.name: athimbleful
blog.title: A Thimbleful
blog.description: ...of salt and other stuff. (Not an asoiaf fan)

summary: I think your summation of what could happen next episode is really good. I hope you’re right. You don’t mention Bran though?...
question: I think your summation of what could happen next episode is really good. I hope you’re right. You don’t mention Bran though? Let’s hope the leaks are wrong because they don’t make sense in my mind. Wouldn’t they want him north with their pack too? For protection. Especially since he’s the world’s “memory”
answer:
Thank you, anon!

I don’t even gonna pretend I understand what they’re doing with Bran so… :D

But I have a crack theory that his mentioning he went back in time to find a wheelchair to replicate means he’ll also go back in time and find schematics to a dragonslaying weapon. It won’t happen, but I really like the idea. :’)

And I hope he wargs into Drogon at some crucial moment.

And as for his ending… Yeah, I’d like him to stay at Winterfell. He has a heart-tree there. He shouldn’t have to sit among roots all day and night deep underground. Perhaps the Three Eyed Raven can be a bit of a person too?

And I hope he wargs into Drogon at some crucial moment.

And as for his ending… Yeah, I’d like him to stay at Winterfell. He has a heart-tree there. He shouldn’t have to sit among roots all day and night deep underground. Perhaps the Three Eyed Raven can be a bit of a person too?

trail.content_raw:
Thank you, anon!

I don’t even gonna pretend I understand what they’re doing with Bran so… :D

But I have a crack theory that his mentioning he went back in time to find a wheelchair to replicate means he’ll also go back in time and find schematics to a dragonslaying weapon. It won’t happen, but I really like the idea. :’)

And I hope he wargs into Drogon at some crucial moment.

And as for his ending… Yeah, I’d like him to stay at Winterfell. He has a heart-tree there. He shouldn’t have to sit among roots all day and night deep underground. Perhaps the Three Eyed Raven can be a bit of a person too?
trail.content:
Thank you, anon!

I don’t even gonna pretend I understand what they’re doing with Bran so… :D

But I have a crack theory that his mentioning he went back in time to find a wheelchair to replicate means he’ll also go back in time and find schematics to a dragonslaying weapon. It won’t happen, but I really like the idea. :’)

And I hope he wargs into Drogon at some crucial moment.

And as for his ending… Yeah, I’d like him to stay at Winterfell. He has a heart-tree there. He shouldn’t have to sit among roots all day and night deep underground. Perhaps the Three Eyed Raven can be a bit of a person too?

blog.name: whatmakesmebleed
blog.title: always dreaming a little bigger
blog.description: Amber. california girl living in oregon. mildly obsessed with the clouds. easily amused. takes a lot of pictures. movie whore. Inception is a must. Joseph Gordon-Levitt. Star Wars. Harry Potter; either way is awesome. Ron/Hermione are where it's at. will read anything and everything. tv junkie. Game of Thrones. completely heart the bbc. love musicals and plays, would see one everyday if I could. lover of travel. definitely left a little of my heart in NYC.

tags: i juat want to be happy
summary: So if shit goes down the way most of us think it’s going to I’m gonna need a favor. All you fanfiction writers, I’m gonna need...
body: So if shit goes down the way most of us think it’s going to I’m gonna need a favor. All you fanfiction writers, I’m gonna need you more then I ever have. I’m gonna need you all to give us the best alternative stories you have ever given. Just do the last season if you want to, or hell, write the entire story since the time of the first men but seriously I’m gonna need something to help me through this

blog.name: shadowofdarkness22
blog.title: So- AHHHH
blog.description:
Hey I'm Shadow.
Female. 26. Gamer.
This is a ship friendly blog. You like a certain ship? I dont care whether I like it or not because I mind my own damn business and leave you alone.
I'm open minded to multiple ships in one fandom because why the fuck not? That doesn't mean I don't have an OTP I'm just chill.
Xemnas/Sora shipper since KH2 came out.
I write.
I make videos sometimes.
I post my friend's art for her since she doesn't have a tumblr.
I reblog whatever is my fancy. I also get random mood changes and spam random things straight. Oops. 
I will most likely post something REALLY clever every so often.

summary: If the leaks turn out to be true, it will be the most disappointing ending in the history. Shipping wars and pointless deaths...
body: If the leaks turn out to be true, it will be the most disappointing ending in the history. Shipping wars and pointless deaths aside, all of the characters deserved better. Because Game of Thrones is a beautiful story which needs a beautiful closure and the leaks show that it ain’t gonna be so. Just disappointing.

reblog.comment: If the leaks turn out to be true, it will be the most disappointing ending in the history. Shipping wars and pointless deaths aside, all of the characters deserved better.
